userID.name: EmotionalDependency
userID.description: Describes how a person manages emotional connections in relationships, including their comfort level with seeking or providing emotional support.
userID.exampleQuestion: How often do you feel the need to check in with your partner for emotional support?
options: Independent with occasional emotional support
Interdependent with regular check-ins
Needs consistent reassurance

userID.name: ImaginationAndFantasy
userID.description: Reflects how much an individual values imagination and creativity, and their comfort with fantasizing about future possibilities.
userID.exampleQuestion: Do you enjoy daydreaming about future plans, or do you prefer focusing on realistic goals?
options: Loves creative daydreaming and making plans for the future
Focuses primarily on realistic, achievable goals
Enjoys imaginative thinking but keeps it private

userID.name: SentimentalAttachment
userID.description: Indicates how emotionally attached a person is to objects or places, and the significance they place on memories associated with them.
userID.exampleQuestion: How important are keepsakes and souvenirs to you in maintaining memories?
options: Holds on to keepsakes from memorable experiences
Values only significant or family-related items
Prefers not to hold onto sentimental items

userID.name: ExpectationsManagement
userID.description: Describes how a person copes with expectations and reality, including how well they adapt to changes or unexpected outcomes.
userID.exampleQuestion: How do you react when plans don’t go as expected?
options: Adapts quickly to changes
Struggles but works on adjusting expectations
Needs reassurance when plans fall through

userID.name: SpontaneityVsRoutine
userID.description: Reflects how much spontaneity versus routine an individual prefers in their daily life and relationships.
userID.exampleQuestion: Do you prefer having a set schedule, or do you enjoy spontaneous surprises?
options: Loves surprises within routine
Prefers stable routines, minimal surprises
Needs frequent spontaneous changes to stay engaged

userID.name: SelfNarrative
userID.description: Describes the roles or narratives that a person holds about themselves, especially during challenging situations.
userID.exampleQuestion: How do you usually perceive yourself in challenging situations—are you the problem-solver, supporter, or something else?
options: Sees themselves as a hero during challenges
Views themselves as a survivor, overcoming adversity
Takes on the role of mediator in conflicts

userID.name: PhysicalAffection
userID.description: Reflects a person's comfort level with physical affection, both in romantic and platonic relationships.
userID.exampleQuestion: How comfortable are you with physical gestures of affection, such as hugging or holding hands?
options: Comfortable with casual and platonic touch
Reserves physical affection for close relationships
Enjoys frequent affectionate gestures, including with friends

userID.name: CuriosityAndLearningStyle
userID.description: Indicates how a person prefers to learn new things, whether through exploration, hands-on activities, or conversations.
userID.exampleQuestion: How do you prefer to learn—by reading, doing hands-on activities, or having in-depth discussions?
options: Loves to read and explore new subjects
Prefers hands-on learning through activities
Enjoys learning through deep conversations

userID.name: Playfulness
userID.description: Describes how playful and lighthearted a person is, and their comfort with engaging in childlike activities.
userID.exampleQuestion: How often do you find yourself engaging in playful or spontaneous fun activities?
options: Frequently engages in playful, childlike activities
Enjoys structured activities more than spontaneous play
Prefers light playfulness, keeps it moderate

userID.name: EmpathyAndBoundaries
userID.description: Reflects how empathetic a person is and how they balance caring for others with setting personal boundaries.
userID.exampleQuestion: Do you find it easy to set boundaries while helping others, or do you often put others' needs first?
options: Always helps others, often at personal cost
Balances caring for others with personal boundaries
Struggles to set boundaries when helping others

userID.name: IndividualityInRelationships
userID.description: Describes how much a person values maintaining their individuality while being in a relationship and how they express that.
userID.exampleQuestion: How important is it for you to maintain your hobbies or personal activities while in a relationship?
options: Likes sharing hobbies with partner or friends
Prefers keeping some hobbies personal
Needs partner/friend to celebrate their unique quirks

userID.name: ComfortWithBoredom
userID.description: Indicates how a person deals with boredom, including their preferences for constant activity or finding comfort in quiet moments.
userID.exampleQuestion: How do you typically handle downtime—do you seek out activities, or are you comfortable with quiet time?
options: Needs constant activity to feel engaged
Finds comfort in quiet, mundane moments
Relies on hobbies to fill downtime

userID.name: AttitudeTowardAuthority
userID.description: Reflects a person's attitude towards rules and authority, whether they prefer structure or challenge conventions.
userID.exampleQuestion: Do you prefer following established rules, or do you tend to challenge conventions?
options: Prefers rules and structured environments
Challenges conventions and likes being non-traditional
Finds balance between respecting and questioning authority

userID.name: ComfortRituals
userID.description: Describes the rituals or activities that provide comfort to a person, including unique or traditional sources of comfort.
userID.exampleQuestion: What are some of the rituals or activities that you turn to for comfort?
options: Finds comfort in unique rituals (e.g., sitting in the dark)
Prefers traditional comforting activities (e.g., tea, reading)
Enjoys repetitive tasks or activities to feel grounded

userID.name: GiftPreferences
userID.description: Reflects a person's attitude towards giving and receiving gifts, including whether they value material or experiential gifts.
userID.exampleQuestion: Do you prefer giving and receiving physical gifts, or do you value experiences more?
options: Loves giving and receiving thoughtful gifts
Prefers experiential gifts over material ones
Indifferent to the act of gift-giving

userID.name: FoodAndSharedMeals
userID.description: Indicates how a person views food and shared meals, whether as a bonding experience, an area for experimentation, or a functional necessity.
userID.exampleQuestion: How do you feel about sharing meals—do you see it as a bonding experience, or is it more functional for you?
options: Enjoys cooking and sharing meals as bonding time
Loves trying new cuisines and experimenting with recipes
Prefers simple, functional meals without emphasis on sharing

userID.name: EmotionalRiskTaking
userID.description: Describes how comfortable a person is with emotional vulnerability, especially early in relationships.
userID.exampleQuestion: How comfortable are you with sharing your feelings early in a relationship?
options: Open with feelings early in relationships
Requires a lot of trust before opening up
Prefers to keep emotions private

userID.name: AdaptabilityToChanges
userID.description: Reflects how well a person adapts to changes and unexpected situations, including their need for support during transitions.
userID.exampleQuestion: How do you generally cope with unexpected changes in plans?
options: Easily adaptable to unexpected changes
Needs time to process sudden changes
Requires emotional support to adjust to change

userID.name: DetailOrientationVsBigPicture
userID.description: Indicates whether a person is more detail-oriented or prefers focusing on the big picture, and how they balance both perspectives.
userID.exampleQuestion: Are you more focused on the finer details of a situation, or do you prefer to see the overall picture?
options: Detail-oriented, likes focusing on specifics
Big-picture thinker, prefers broader perspective
Enjoys a balance of both detailed and big-picture thinking

userID.name: OpennessToSharingThoughts
userID.description: Describes how open a person is about their internal thoughts and emotions, and how much they share with others.
userID.exampleQuestion: How open are you when it comes to sharing your thoughts and feelings with others?
options: Open about internal thoughts and emotions
Keeps personal thoughts mostly private
Shares selectively depending on trust and comfort

userID.name: HandlingCriticism
userID.description: Reflects how a person responds to criticism, whether they are open to constructive feedback or need positive reinforcement.
userID.exampleQuestion: How do you typically react to criticism—do you take it constructively, or do you find it challenging at first?
options: Takes feedback as constructive and reflects
Can be defensive at first, then accepts criticism
Prefers gentle, positive reinforcement when receiving feedback

userID.name: CreativityAndArt
userID.description: Indicates a person's connection to creativity and art, whether as an active form of expression or something they appreciate passively.
userID.exampleQuestion: How important is creative expression to you, and do you actively engage in creative activities?
options: Deeply values creative expression as an emotional outlet
Appreciates creativity but does not practice it personally
Occasionally enjoys creative activities but doesn't focus on them

userID.name: PatienceLevel
userID.description: Describes a person's level of patience, including whether they prefer slow processes or quick results.
userID.exampleQuestion: Would you consider yourself a patient person, or do you prefer quick resolutions?
options: Generally very patient, enjoys slow processes
Impatient, prefers quick results and actions
Balanced level of patience depending on the situation

userID.name: AttitudeTowardAging
userID.description: Reflects a person's perspective on aging, whether they embrace it, feel anxious, or view it neutrally.
userID.exampleQuestion: How do you feel about the process of aging—do you embrace it or find it concerning?
options: Embraces aging and celebrates the process
Anxious about getting older, prefers to avoid the topic
Sees aging neutrally, as just part of life

userID.name: RepetitionAndHabits
userID.description: Indicates a person's comfort with repetitive habits and routines, or their need for variety and change.
userID.exampleQuestion: How comfortable are you with routines and repetitive habits?
options: Finds stability in repeated habits and routines
Prefers variety and change to stay stimulated
Enjoys a mix of predictable routines and occasional changes

userID.name: KindnessToStrangers
userID.description: Describes how a person treats strangers, including their inclination toward random acts of kindness.
userID.exampleQuestion: How often do you find yourself performing random acts of kindness for strangers?
options: Regularly practices random acts of kindness
Kind but indifferent unless prompted
Reserved, doesn’t engage much with strangers

userID.name: FantasyVsReality
userID.description: Reflects how a person balances fantasy and realism, including whether they idealize situations or prefer a practical approach.
userID.exampleQuestion: Do you often find yourself idealizing situations, or do you prefer staying grounded in reality?
options: Often idealizes situations and people
Prefers to stay grounded in reality
Occasionally indulges in fantasy but tries to stay practical

userID.name: HandlingAwkwardSituations
userID.description: Describes how a person handles awkward or uncomfortable situations, whether through humor, avoidance, or direct confrontation.
userID.exampleQuestion: How do you usually handle awkward situations—do you try to diffuse them with humor or address them directly?
options: Uses humor to break awkward tension
Avoids or ignores awkward situations
Confronts awkwardness directly to resolve it

userID.name: AppreciationOfBeauty
userID.description: Indicates how much a person notices and appreciates beauty in their surroundings, and whether they share these moments with others.
userID.exampleQuestion: How often do you stop to appreciate the beauty around you, like a sunset or a piece of art?
options: Notices and appreciates beauty in small, everyday moments
Enjoys beautiful moments privately
Appreciates beauty but rarely vocalizes it

userID.name: TechnologyAndConnectivity
userID.description: Reflects how comfortable a person is with technology, including their preference for constant connectivity or minimal tech use.
userID.exampleQuestion: How connected do you prefer to be—do you like staying constantly online, or do you value digital detox time?
options: Very connected, loves constant digital interaction
Prefers minimal tech use, likes digital detox
Balances technology use, prefers offline quality time

userID.name: ConflictResolutionStyle
userID.description: Describes how a person approaches conflict, whether they avoid confrontation, face issues directly, or need time to process.
userID.exampleQuestion: How do you typically handle conflicts—do you prefer addressing them head-on or avoiding confrontation?
options: Prefers avoiding confrontation to keep peace
Faces issues head-on, values direct conversation
Needs time to process before addressing conflict

userID.name: HandlingSuccessAndFailure
userID.description: Reflects how a person deals with success and failure, including their preference for sharing openly or handling emotions privately.
userID.exampleQuestion: When you experience success or failure, do you like to share it with others or prefer keeping it to yourself?
options: Shares achievements and struggles openly
Prefers celebrating or grieving alone
Involves close friends or partners in significant moments

userID.name: OpennessToGrowth
userID.description: Indicates a person's approach to personal growth, whether they prefer growing with others, individually, or at a gradual pace.
userID.exampleQuestion: How do you view personal growth—do you prefer growing alongside others, or do you see it as an individual journey?
options: Believes in growing together with partners/friends
Sees personal growth as a solo journey
Likes change but takes gradual steps

userID.name: LocationAndLifestylePreferences
userID.description: Describes the type of environment a person prefers to live in, including their openness to relocation.
userID.exampleQuestion: What type of environment do you prefer to live in—urban, rural, or are you flexible?
options: Urban, loves city life
Suburban/Rural, prefers peace and quiet
Flexible, open to relocation

userID.name: InterestsAndHobbies
userID.description: Reflects a person's hobbies and interests, whether they enjoy outdoor activities, creative pursuits, or intellectual engagement.
userID.exampleQuestion: What types of activities do you most enjoy—are you more into outdoor adventures, creative hobbies, or intellectual pursuits?
options: Loves outdoor activities (e.g., hiking, running)
Enjoys artistic hobbies (e.g., painting, writing)
Interested in intellectual activities (e.g., chess, reading)

userID.name: EducationAndIntellectualCompatibility
userID.description: Indicates a person's intellectual preferences, including their value for formal education or life experience, and topics of interest.
userID.exampleQuestion: Do you value formal education, or do you prefer learning through life experiences?
options: Values formal education
Learns best through life experiences
Prefers discussing complex, thought-provoking topics

userID.name: SocialPreferences
userID.description: Describes a person's social style, whether they are extroverted, introverted, or a mix of both.
userID.exampleQuestion: How would you describe your social style—do you prefer large gatherings, small groups, or time alone?
options: Extrovert, loves meeting new people and being social
Introvert, prefers quality time with close friends
Ambivert, enjoys both socializing and alone time

userID.name: FamilyDynamics
userID.description: Reflects a person's relationship with their family, including their expectations for family involvement in their relationships.
userID.exampleQuestion: How close are you with your family, and what role do you expect them to play in your relationships?
options: Very close to family, expects partner to integrate
Keeps distance, prefers not to involve family much
Seeks balanced relationship with family involvement

userID.name: PastRelationships
userID.description: Describes how a person views and deals with their past relationships, whether they are open about them or prefer to keep them private.
userID.exampleQuestion: How comfortable are you discussing your past relationships—do you see them as valuable learning experiences?
options: Open and honest about past relationships
Prefers not to talk about the past often
Uses past relationships to learn and grow

userID.name: ReligionAndSpiritualBeliefs
userID.description: Indicates a person's religious or spiritual beliefs, including their level of practice and openness to differing beliefs.
userID.exampleQuestion: How important are religious or spiritual beliefs in your life, and do you prefer having a partner with similar beliefs?
options: Actively religious/spiritual, needs similar values
Spiritually curious, open-minded
Indifferent, respects others’ beliefs but not personally engaged
